faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: A sworn translation is an official translation carried out by a translator appointed by the government (MAEC or German Courts). It bears a seal and signature, giving it legal validity before authorities.
faq.a2: Standard documents (e.g., birth certificates) are usually processed within 24-48 hours. Postal delivery from Spain to Germany takes approx. 3-5 days.
faq.q3: Do you need the original document?
faq.a3: In most cases, a high-quality scan is sufficient. The translation will certify that it is a 'translation of a copy/scan'. This is accepted in 99% of cases (please verify with your authority).
faq.q4: Is the translation valid in Germany?
faq.a4: Yes. As a translator authorized by the Higher Regional Court of Cologne (OLG Köln), my translations are officially recognized by German authorities.
faq.a5: You will receive an invoice including VAT. Payment is conveniently made via bank transfer.

aboutPage.title: María Ángeles Capas – Your Translator
aboutPage.introduction: As a dual-qualified translator, I bridge the legal systems of Spain and Germany. My authorization by the OLG Cologne and appointment by the Spanish Ministry guarantee maximum legal certainty.
aboutPage.paragraph1: For years, I have been assisting law firms, notaries, companies, and individuals in overcoming language barriers in international bureaucracy. I understand that in legal texts, every detail counts.
aboutPage.paragraph2: In addition to my legal expertise, I also offer technical translations. Based in Spain with accreditation in Germany, I am the ideal link for your international affairs.
aboutPage.conclusion: Personal service, direct communication, and absolute confidentiality are my standards. I look forward to assisting you.
